constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details required for Condition 8 (Hard and Soft Landscaping Scheme) of planning application 18/12924/FUL (Demolition of existing buildings and erection of part 3 part 4 storey mixed use building to provide commercial use on part of the ground floor with flexible B1(a) office use and D1 health centre/surgery use, erection of no. 6 flats on the ground and upper floors together with the provision of associated amenity space, refuse and cycle storage facilities and car parking)
decision_conditions: The submitted details are unacceptable and show an incorrect layout in comparison to that approved under planning permission 18/12924/FUL. As such the proposed development would not be in the interests of visual amenity, thereby conflicting with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted 2012.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed and are hereby approved, subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details (Corum Brick), in relation to Condition 5 (Material samples) of Planning Permission 21/03204/FUL, which states:Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, samples of the facing brick to be utilised in the development (Units 8 / 9 as shown on Proposed Site Plan - Drawing Number C-233-TP-02 Rev L), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Officer comments: The submitted Vandersanden corum brick is a buff brick of reasonably good quality which is considered compatible with the mix of brick evident along Red Lion Road and consistent with the visuals provided as part of the parent planning permission.

You have returned blank compies of the Biodiversity Checklist and CIL Forms, therefore we are still awaiting completed forms. For completeness we set out the same documents that were reference in our last Invalid letter.
